publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence with various public and private firms requesting specialized services. It also includes orders, diagrams of machinery, and descriptions of problems associated with faulty products.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: The Kingsford Foundry and Machine Works was originally a branch of the Kingsford Starch Company founded in 1848 in Oswego, New York. The foundry was established as a separate company in 1869 to produce and repair machinery. The foundry closed in 1967, and was to become the last of the Kingsford Companies to succumb to closure.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence with various public and private firms requesting specialized services. It also includes orders, diagrams of machinery, and descriptions of problems associated with faulty products.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p: Twenty-nine items of correspondence, mostly incoming. Includes diagrams. Arranged chronologically. September 30, 1907 -- July 22, 1914. One undated letter. Eight correspondences from Theo. T. Mersueau Topic: boiler construction and machinery.
